awd_titl_txt: Standard Model Predictions for Physics at High Energy       Colliders
awd_abstract_narration: Theoretical analyses in elementary particle physics will                   determine the predictions of the "standard model" of the basic                  forces for a variety of physical processes which are to be                      explored experimentally at high energy particle colliders of                    the present and future.  These processes include production of                  the particles which "carry" the weak force, production of jets                  of nuclear particles, and production of the hypothetical Higgs                  particle which is related to the origin of mass.  If we are to                  be able to use experimental data on these processes as evidence                 of physics that goes beyond the well - established but limited                  "standard model," then we must first know the standard model                    predictions for the processes.  Hence, the studies to be                        undertaken in this project are an important step in the search                  for physics beyond the standard model.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
